.T: Emergence of the drug-resistant phenotype in tumor subpopulations: a hybrid model.

.T: Occupational risks of bladder cancer in the United States: I. White men.

Forty-five percent of all respondents believed that physicians who were HIV infected should not be allowed to continue to practice. More than half of those who had seen a physician in the past 5 years said they would change physicians if they knew their physician were HIV infected, while one fourth said they would seek care elsewhere if their physician were treating people with HIV disease. Physicians and the public need to be educated about this policy and its appropriateness.
